sleep.0-5: You are not getting enough sleep. Aim for 7-8 hours per night. Avoid caffeine late in the day and try meditation before bed.
sleep.6-7: Sleep is okay. Keep a consistent bedtime routine, reduce screen time before bed, and maintain a calm environment.
sleep.8-10: Great! Maintain your current sleep schedule and continue with balanced meals to support hormonal health.

Cramps: Include magnesium-rich foods: spinach, almonds, pumpkin seeds.
Eat anti-inflammatory foods: turmeric, ginger, fatty fish.
Drink herbal teas: chamomile or peppermint.
Avoid excessive sugar and processed foods.
Include complex carbs like oats and quinoa for steady energy.
Bloating: Include fiber-rich foods: oats, beans, lentils.
Stay hydrated to reduce water retention.
Mood Swings: Eat complex carbs: brown rice, oats, quinoa.
Include omega-3 fatty acids: walnuts, chia seeds, fish.
Practice mindfulness or journaling to manage stress.
Drink herbal teas: chamomile, lemon balm.
Fatigue: Increase iron-rich foods: spinach, beans, red meat.
Include vitamin C to enhance absorption: citrus fruits.
Snack on nuts and seeds for energy.
Drink enough water to prevent dehydration.
Avoid skipping meals and maintain a balanced diet.
Acne: Eat zinc-rich foods: pumpkin seeds, chickpeas.
Stay hydrated and include leafy greens.
Headache: Eat magnesium-rich foods: almonds, dark chocolate.
Practice gentle neck and shoulder stretches.
Take breaks from screens and bright lights.
Back Pain: Perform light stretching and yoga for lower back.
Avoid lifting heavy weights during periods.
Breast Tenderness: Wear supportive bras and avoid tight clothing.
Include vitamin E-rich foods: almonds, sunflower seeds.

Severe: Consult a gynecologist if pain is severe or cycles are irregular.
Track your cycle for 3 months to observe patterns.
Avoid self-medicating with strong painkillers frequently.
Note any unusual bleeding and inform your doctor.
Medication: Check interactions with any ongoing medications.
Inform your doctor about supplements or herbal remedies.
Avoid taking new medication without consulting a doctor.
Irregular Cycle: Consider hormonal evaluation if cycles are less than 21 or more than 35 days.
Maintain a healthy lifestyle and track period symptoms.
Consult a gynecologist for PCOS or thyroid-related issues.

Cramps.name: Heat Pad
Cramps.description: Provides gentle warmth to relax uterine muscles and relieve period cramps naturally.
Cramps.benefits: Reduces abdominal pain, improves blood flow, and helps ease tension.
Cramps.usage: Place on your lower abdomen for 15–20 minutes as needed.

Cramps.name: Magnesium Supplement
Cramps.description: Supports muscle relaxation and helps reduce menstrual cramps and fatigue.
Cramps.benefits: Relieves cramps, supports hormonal balance, and promotes relaxation.
Cramps.usage: Take one tablet daily with water, preferably after a meal.

Cramps.name: Herbal Tea
Cramps.description: Natural tea blend to soothe discomfort and reduce inflammation during menstruation.
Cramps.benefits: Calms nerves, relieves pain, and promotes better sleep.
Cramps.usage: Brew one cup daily during your period for best results.

Cramps.name: Acupressure Band
Cramps.description: Applies gentle pressure on key points to help relieve cramps without medication.
Cramps.benefits: Natural pain relief method without side effects.
Cramps.usage: Wear around the wrist or abdomen as per product instruction.

Headache.name: Ibuprofen Tablets
Headache.description: Pain reliever for mild to moderate headaches during menstruation.
Headache.usage: Take one tablet with water as needed, not exceeding the recommended dose.

Headache.name: Peppermint Essential Oil
Headache.description: Soothes tension headaches with cooling effect when applied topically.
Headache.benefits: Relieves headache pain and calms nerves.
Headache.usage: Dilute a few drops in carrier oil and apply to temples and forehead.

Headache.name: Cooling Gel Eye Mask
Headache.description: Provides gentle cold therapy to reduce headache discomfort.
Headache.benefits: Eases tension headaches and relaxes eyes.
Headache.usage: Place over eyes for 10–15 minutes whenever needed.

Headache.name: Chamomile Tea
Headache.description: Natural tea to relax and reduce headache intensity.
Headache.benefits: Calms nerves and reduces stress-related headaches.
Headache.usage: Brew one cup daily or during headache episodes.

Bloating.name: Probiotics

Bloating.name: Digestive Enzyme Supplement
Bloating.description: Helps your body break down food and prevents indigestion-related bloating.

Mood Swings.description: Regulates hormones and helps the body cope with stress.

Mood Swings.description: Calming tea that relaxes the body and reduces anxiety.

Fatigue.benefits: Prevents anemia and improves overall energy levels.

Acne.benefits: Improves skin texture and prevents acne outbreaks.
